Sentencas: Strontium doped lanthanum vanadates, La1-xSrxVO3 (denoted LSV with x=0, 0.3, 0.5, 0.7 and 1.0), were synthesized using a solid-state reaction method.
Titulo: Chemical, electrical, and thermal properties of strontium doped lanthanum vanadate

Sentencas: The oxidation and reduction behaviors of LSV were studied using thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) and differential scanning calorimetry (DSC).
Titulo: Chemical, electrical, and thermal properties of strontium doped lanthanum vanadate

Sentencas: The chemical stability of LSV in a reducing atmosphere containing H2S UP to 10 vol.% at 950 degrees C was investigated and their electrical conductivity at 500-1000 degrees C in reducing atmospheres measured with a 4-electrode technique.
Titulo: Chemical, electrical, and thermal properties of strontium doped lanthanum vanadate

Sentencas: The coefficient of thermal expansion (CTE) was determined by dilatometry.
Titulo: Chemical, electrical, and thermal properties of strontium doped lanthanum vanadate

Sentencas: The electrochemical catalytic activity of LSV as anodes in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) was characterized using impedance spectroscopy.
Titulo: Chemical, electrical, and thermal properties of strontium doped lanthanum vanadate

Sentencas: It was found that the La1-xSrxVO3 materials with x in the range of 0.3-0.7 exhibit good resistance to H2S, high electrical conductivity and acceptable catalytic activity at elevated temperatures in reducing atmosphere.
Titulo: Chemical, electrical, and thermal properties of strontium doped lanthanum vanadate

Sentencas: However, the volume change associated with oxidation/reduction cycle may limit their tolerance to re-oxidation when used as anode materials for SOFCs.
Titulo: Chemical, electrical, and thermal properties of strontium doped lanthanum vanadate
Chemical, electrical, and thermal properties of strontium doped lanthanum vanadate
